required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the Safety and Performance of the MINITAC◊ Titanium 2.0 Suture Anchor
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Performance of MINITAC◊ Ti 2.0 Suture Anchor in Extremities

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective study evaluating the safety and performance of the MINITAC Suture anchors for extremities repair. Data will be used to support Notified Body (BSI) requirements for extremities repair indications.

detailed_description.textblock: Up to 3 sites will participate in the study across Australia and the EU, collectively enrolling a minimum of 30 and a maximum of 50 subjects into the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical success rate (%) of the MINITAC◊ Ti 2.0 Suture Anchor in extremities at 6 months post-operative
primary_outcome.description: Clinical success defined as extremity repairs without signs of device failure and/or reintervention as assessed by the surgeon.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical success rate (%) of the MINITAC◊ Ti 2.0 Suture Anchor in extremities at 12 months post-operative

clinical_study.condition: Ulnar or Radial Collateral Ligament Reconstructions

arm_group.description: Subjects who have undergone extremities repair using the Minitac Ti 2.0 Suture anchor

intervention.description: The MINITAC◊ Ti 2.0 Suture Anchor is intended to provide secure reattachment of soft tissue to bone in the foot and ankle as well as elbow, wrist and hand.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subject has undergone extremities repair using the MINITAC◊ Ti 2.0 Suture Anchor.
2. Subject was ≥ 18 years of age at time of surgery.
3. Subject status is > 12 months post-operative.
Exclusion Criteria:
Subject is entered in another investigational drug, biologic, or device study or has been treated with an investigational product within 12 months post-operative.

overall_official.affiliation: Clinical Director, Global Clinical Strategy, Sports Med and ENT Smith & Nephew
